result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vang Xiong

defendant.name: Xiong, Vang
defendant.address: 4901 Bald Eagle Ave, White Bear Lake, MN 53110

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:05 AM cases 22CF530, 22CF679 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Vang Xiong appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Vang Xiong.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Parties have not resolved the matter yet. Parties would like one more return before setting for trial. A status conference is scheduled for Dec 22, 2022 at 3:00 pm.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:08 AM cases 22CF530, 22CF679 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Vang Xiong appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Vang Xiong.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In 22CF679: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Both files: A status conference is scheduled for 10/27/22 at 9:00 AM (via zoom).

(Cases called 22CF679 an 22CF530 at 10:57 AM)
Defendant appeared with Attorney Francis Rivard.  State by Andrew Gunderson ADA
Arraignment on 22CF530, Information filed.  Not Guilty's pleas received by Court.
22CF679 -time limits have been waived for preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court reviews constitutional rights for preliminary hearing, Court accepts and finds defendant has waived preliminary hearing.
22CF679 -Arraignment and 22CF530 Status Conference scheduled on 08-23-22 at 11 am. for 30 minutes in person.
22CF530 Defense requests the No contact with Regency bond condition be removed.  State has no objection, Regency Inn is not a victim.  Court approves defense request to remove the no contact with Regency Inn from bond.
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(11:16 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vang Xiong appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia Anderson appeared by video for Vang Xiong. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Vang Xiong.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Parties advise the defendant has a case pending in Branch 3 and requests this be scheduled with the defendant's other case.
Hearing to be scheduled in Branch 3.

Conditions:
No contact with Regency Inn.

Conditions:
No contact with Regency Inn.
